name: Empirical CDF
description:
Suppose we have random variables $X_1, X_2, \ldots, X_n$ which are iid and share the same CDF $F$ which is unknown. We can approximate $F$ with an empirical CDF given by:

$$F_n(\omega,t)=\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^n\mathbb{1}\left(t\geq X_i(\omega)\right)$$

For each fixed $\omega$, $F_n$ is a function of $t$ and fits our interpretation of a CDF. Furthermore, observe that $F_n$ is a step-like function per the summed indicator functions so it's only an approximation of whatever $F$ truly is. It follows that the error within our emperical CDF is $e=|F_n(\omega, t)-F(t)|$.
